title: Agreement (Matching Adjective to Noun).
reading_greek: Ο σκύλος είναι μεγάλος. Η γάτα είναι μικρή. Το παιδί είναι καλό. Ο μεγάλος σκύλος βλέπει την μικρή γάτα. Το καλό παιδί παίζει.
reading_english: The dog is big. The cat is small. The child is good. The big dog sees the small cat. The good child is playing.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 6! Today we are focusing on a crucial element of Greek grammar: Agreement, specifically matching the Adjective to the Noun...  In Greek, the adjective must agree with the noun it modifies in three ways: Case, Gender, and Number... We will focus mainly on Gender today...  If the noun is Masculine, the adjective must be Masculine... If the noun is Feminine, the adjective must be Feminine... If the noun is Neuter, the adjective must be Neuter...  Listen to this short passage, paying attention to how the endings of the adjectives change to match the nouns... Ο σκύλος είναι μεγάλος... The dog is big... Skýlos is masculine, so the adjective is megalos...  Η γάτα είναι μικρή... The cat is small... Gháta is feminine, so the adjective is mikri...  Το παιδί είναι καλό... The child is good... Paidí is neuter, so the adjective is kaló...  Now listen to the full passage... Ο σκύλος είναι μεγάλος. Η γάτα είναι μικρή. Το παιδί είναι καλό. Ο μεγάλος σκύλος βλέπει την μικρή γάτα. Το καλό παιδί παίζει... Now, repeat the following key phrases after me... Ο σκύλος... μεγάλος... Η γάτα... μικρή... Το παιδί... καλό...
